p:
A wide variety of Vanilloid compounds of different structures are known in the art, for example those disclosed in European Patent Application Numbers,
EP 0 347 000 and
EP 0 401 903 , UK Patent Application Number
GB 2226313 and International Patent Application, Publication Number
WO 92/09285 . Particularly notable examples of vanilloid compounds or vanilloid receptor modulators are capsaicin or trans 8-methyl-N-vanillyl-6-nonenamide which is isolated from the pepper plant, capsazepine (
Tetrahedron, 53, 1997, 4791 ) and olvanil or - N-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzyl)oleamide (
J. Med. Chem., 36, 1993, 2595 ).
